author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the release of Linux 6.16-rc1 last Sunday that capped off the Linux 6.16 merge window, Linux 6.16-rc2 is now available with an initial week's worth of bug/regression fixes. Linux 6.16 development continues in aiming toward a stable release around the end of July...
title: Linux 6.16-rc2 Released With An Initial Batch Of Fixes

author: Michael Larabel
description: Back in May a big patch series was published for reworking the Linux kernel to make the SMP support unconditional. Right now those that happen to be running Linux in a uniprocessor (1 CPU core) configuration can build with "CONFIG_SMP" disabled but the proposed patches would make symmetric multi-processing support always present. Those patches took a step forward this week and could be merged for the Linux 6.17 cycle later in the summer...
title: Linux 6.17 Looks Like It Could Go Ahead And Make SMP Support Unconditional

author: Michael Larabel
description: The X.Org Server has been seeing a lot of commits this week... to revert bad code...
title: The Latest X.Org Server Activity Are A Lot Of Code Reverts

author: Michael Larabel
description: While the Linux 6.16 merge window just passed one week ago, already there are new feature changes beginning to queue for the Linux 6.17 kernel later in the summer...
title: Graphics Driver Changes Begin Queuing Ahead Of Linux 6.17

author: Michael Larabel
description: Prominent AMD Mesa developer Marek Olšák this week landed a number of fixes for the RadeonSI Gallium3D driver code in working to enable medium precision "mediump" support for this open-source graphics driver...
title: 16-bit Medium Precision Improvements Merged For AMD Radeon Mesa Code
